intro: Diodia stipulosa, commonly known as false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its roots and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Diodia stipulosa thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks.
